trans-unit.source: Ends an asynchronous operation to open a stream for reading from the blob.
trans-unit.target: Ends an asynchronous operation to open a stream for reading from the blob.

trans-unit.source: An <codeEntityReference>T:System.IAsyncResult</codeEntityReference> that references the pending asynchronous operation.
trans-unit.target: An <codeEntityReference>T:System.IAsyncResult</codeEntityReference> that references the pending asynchronous operation.

trans-unit.source: A stream to be used for reading from the blob.
trans-unit.target: A stream to be used for reading from the blob.

trans-unit.source: On the <codeEntityReference>T:System.IO.Stream</codeEntityReference> object returned by this method, the <codeEntityReference>M:System.IO.Stream.EndRead(System.IAsyncResult)</codeEntityReference> method must be called exactly once for every <codeEntityReference>M:System.IO.Stream.BeginRead(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)</codeEntityReference> call.
trans-unit.target: On the <codeEntityReference>T:System.IO.Stream</codeEntityReference> object returned by this method, the <codeEntityReference>M:System.IO.Stream.EndRead(System.IAsyncResult)</codeEntityReference> method must be called exactly once for every <codeEntityReference>M:System.IO.Stream.BeginRead(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)</codeEntityReference> call.

trans-unit.source: Failing to end the read process before beginning another read process can cause unexpected behavior.
trans-unit.target: Failing to end the read process before beginning another read process can cause unexpected behavior.
